arts.ttl: 'He knows he should have saved that'- Hart on Ederson conceding Forest winner
arts.sum: Joe Hart discusses Manchester City goalkeeper Ederson's performance after he let in a goal "he should have saved" to give Nottingham Forest a crucial Premier League victory.

arts.ttl: It is 'not easy' to play against Forest - Guardiola
arts.sum: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola says it is "not easy" to play against Nottingham Forest after his side suffered a 1-0 defeat following a late goal scored by Callum Hudson-Odoi in the Premier League.

arts.ttl: Forest STUN Man City to move four points clear in third
arts.sum: Hudson-Odoi, who had already seen a curler brilliantly tipped onto the post by Ederson, then ensured Forest got back to winning ways, ending a run of three matches without a victory. City started the game brightly, with Erling Haaland gifted an early chance as he picked Chris Wood ’s pocket just outside the box, only to drag his low shot through Murillo ’s legs and wide of the far post.

arts.ttl: Nottingham Forest secure crucial win as Brighton snatch dramatic Premier League victory
arts.sum: Elsewhere, Ollie Watkins scored against his former club as Aston Villa beat Brentford, and Crystal Palace continued their good form

arts.ttl: Callum Hudson-Odoi will get all the plaudits but £8m Nottingham Forest star was the real hero vs Man City - opinion
arts.sum: A performance that may go under the radar...

arts.ttl: Pep Guardiola makes TWO Man City demands clear after Nottingham Forest defeat
arts.sum: A flat Manchester City display at the City Ground saw Nottingham Forest claim a 1-0 win in the battle of Champions League hopefuls, and ensured Nuno Espirito Santo's men moved four points clear of the champions

arts.ttl: Mohamed Salah hits new Liverpool goalscoring milestones as Erling Haaland, Thierry Henry record matched
arts.sum: Liverpool wing king Mohamed Salah hits yet another goalscoring landmark with his brace in the Reds' 3-1 Premier League comeback victory over Southampton.

arts.ttl: Pep Guardiola defends Ederson after Man City goalkeeper let late winner slip through his grasp in 1-0 defeat by Nottingham Forest
arts.sum: Pep Guardiola came to Ederson's defence after the Man City goalkeeper was embarrassingly beaten at his near post in their 1-0 defeat by Nottingham Forest on Saturday.

arts.ttl: Man City have '10 finals' to 'avoid disaster'
arts.sum: After slipping to their ninth Premier League defeat of the season, Manchester City have '10 finals' left to qualify for the Champions League, says Pep Guardiola.

arts.ttl: Guardiola admits Manchester City’s Champions League hopes in balance
arts.athr: Peter Lansley at the City Ground
arts.sum: Guardiola rues City’s inconsistency after Forest setback Nuno hails Forest’s defensive display to bolster third spot Pep Guardiola admitted Manchester City’s chances of qualifying for the Champions League are hanging in the balance after their 1-0 defeat by their top-five rivals Nottingham Forest. City were limited to three shots on target, despite dominating with almost 70% possession, as Forest’s ability to soak up pressure and hit superior teams on the break was proven once again by Callum Hudson Odoi’s winner. The City manager paid tribute to Forest’s defensive prowess but pointed out that his team’s chances of qualifying for the competition they won two years ago remain in their own hands. The reigning Premier League champions have won four, including two FA Cup games, and lost five of their last nine matches and Guardiola accepted that results are too inconsistent. Continue reading...
